definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to target sb or sth (for attack, criticism etc)

sentences.english: Subsequent press reports named Bernard as the ambassador responsible.
sentences.chinese: 隨後更有媒體報道將矛頭直指貝納德大使。

sentences.english: I like Spearhead and the Beastie Boys.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡矛頭跟《野獸男孩》。

sentences.english: Sloth turneth the bend of wit.
sentences.chinese: 懶惰能磨去才智的矛頭。

sentences.english: Almost immediately, several blamed traditional arch-enemy Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 矛頭幾乎立刻就指向了印度的宿敵巴基斯坦。

sentences.english: Sloth tarnishes the edge of wit.
sentences.chinese: 懶散能磨去才智的矛頭。

sentences.english: But much of the venom in the press, at any rate, is directed at big multinationals.
sentences.chinese: 然，媒體的許多惡意中傷，矛頭直指大的跨國公司。

sentences.english: And then I directed the spearhead at mother, "You are also so fat.
sentences.chinese: 然後我把矛頭指向媽媽，“你也很胖。

sentences.english: This month the campaign turned more personal.
sentences.chinese: 這個月，這場運動將矛頭指向了個人。

sentences.english: The movement is not anti-business or anti-capitalism.
sentences.chinese: 其矛頭所向並非企業或資本主義。

sentences.english: Bazin is the main point of criticism directed Eisenstein and Pudovkin's.
sentences.chinese: 巴贊批評的矛頭主要是指向愛森斯坦和普多夫金的。

sentences.english: Both direct volleys of abuse at Mr Bush.
sentences.chinese: 兩人都將漫罵的矛頭指向布什先生。
這矛頭引出了許多問題。

sentences.english: The father continues to blame the CDC for trying to dodge the responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 男童父親仍將矛頭指向疾管局，要他們別規避責任。

sentences.english: They take a big shot at those corrupted officials.
sentences.chinese: 他們把矛頭直接對準了腐敗的官吏。

sentences.english: This is the new American world of the Clovis points.
sentences.chinese: 這就是克洛維斯矛頭出現的美洲新世界。

sentences.english: This time the main targets come from China, the rising power to the south.
sentences.chinese: 這一次他們將矛頭直指中國，這個南部崛起的新勢力。

definition: to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
